intro: Amauria, commonly known as the snow buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The plant features delicate, white or pale yellow flowers with five petals and numerous stamens, typical of the family. Its leaves are palmately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Amauria thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
